name: Apple Toddy
description: The apple toddy enjoyed immense popularity during the early 1800s, and continued in regular circulation until Prohibition, when it— along with so many other forms of the liquid arts—was mostly forgotten.
recipeIngredient: 1 apple (go with something tart like Granny Smith, or your favorite)
2 tablespoons sugar, maple syrup or sweetener of choice

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and core the apple and wrap in parchment paper to keep it from falling apart. Place in a baking pan and bake at 350 for 30 - 45 minutes, until very soft.
Rinse two mugs with boiling water to pre-heat, then put 1 tablespoon sugar or syrup in each. Add a splash of boiling water and stir until sugar is dissolved..
Add 2 ounces of apple brandy to each of the mugs. Cut the apple in half and place each half in one of the mugs. Using a muddler or a wooden spoon, crush the apple to a pulp.
Add one or two ounces of boiling water, to taste, and stir until apple has completely fallen apart. Strain into a fresh warm mug (optional), and grate nutmeg over the top of the drink.
